intro: Holigarna grahamii, commonly known as the Graham's holigarna, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing fragrant white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive species in conservation efforts.
